elements.title: Central Post Office (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Kyiv's Central Post Office was built after military forces deliberately destroyed its predecessor (pictured) less than a year after it was completed?

elements.title: The Promised Neverland (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Kaiu Shirai said that some parts of his story The Promised Neverland came from nightmares?

elements.title: agreed to implement (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that on 9 January 1917, German Emperor Wilhelm II agreed to implement unrestricted submarine warfare?

elements.title: Dreamer Isioma (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Dreamer Isioma began learning music theory at the age of three?

elements.title: a program to remove (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the government of Victoria, Australia, has a program to remove 110 level crossings by 2030, the fastest rate in the state's history?

elements.title: Malcolm Gaskill (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that witchcraft historian Malcolm Gaskill documented a real-life 17th-century witch hunt in Springfield, Massachusetts?

elements.title: 1961 Indonesian census (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the 1961 Indonesian census was the country's first since 1930 and the first since gaining independence from the Netherlands?

elements.title: Zenock (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the name Zenock is misspelled in almost every published edition of the Book of Mormon?
